meanings.definition: Choose someone to hold public office or some other position by voting.
meanings.sent1: The class will be electing a new student council president next week.
meanings.sent2: The citizens will be electing their mayor in the upcoming election.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the forest were electing a squirrel as their new leader.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to be electing the moon as its nighttime replacement.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made the process of electing a class monitor fun and exciting for the students.

meanings.definition: To select or choose someone or something for a specific purpose or job.
meanings.sent1: She was electing the best outfit for the party from her wardrobe.
meanings.sent2: The committee will be electing a new chairperson for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The chef was electing the finest ingredients for the special dish.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was electing the perfect spot to plant the new flowers.
meanings.sent5: The coach was electing the team captain based on skill and leadership qualities.
